topoptlab.symfem_utils moduleÔÉÅ

topoptlab.symfem_utils.base_cell(ndim, element_type='Lagrange', order=1)[source]ÔÉÅ

Create the basic cell, location of vertices, the node indices, the reference cell and the basis functions.

Parameters:

  • ndim (int) ‚Äì number of spatial dimensions.

  • element_type (str) ‚Äì type of element.

  • order (int) ‚Äì order of element.

Returns:

  • vertices (tuple) ‚Äì coordinates of vertices

  • nd_inds (list) ‚Äì list of indices with regards to the reference cell of symfem. Check the reference cell numbering out in the symfem documentation or git.

  • reference (symfem.references.vertices) ‚Äì reference cell object.

  • basis (list) ‚Äì list of basis functions.

topoptlab.symfem_utils.convert_from_voigt(A_v)[source]ÔÉÅ

Convert 2nd rank tensor into from its Voigt representation to the standard matrix represenation.

Parameters:

A_v (symfem.functions.MatrixFunction, shape ((ndim**2 + ndim) /2, 1)) ‚Äì 2nd rank tensor in Voigt represenation (so a column vector)

Returns:

A ‚Äì 2nd rank tensor in matrix notation

Return type:

symfem.functions.MatrixFunction, shape (ndim,ndim)

topoptlab.symfem_utils.convert_to_code(matrix, matrices=[], vectors=[], np_functions=['cos', 'sin', 'tan'], npndarray=True, max_line_length=200)[source]ÔÉÅ

Convert the printed expression by symfem to strings that can be converted to code.

Parameters:

  • matrix (symfem.functions.MatrixFunction) ‚Äì symfem output.

  • matrices (list) ‚Äì list of strs for the tensor indices to be converted to array indices. E. g. the tensor ‚Äúc‚Äù appears in the equation, the current element derivation routines will return function that contain the elements of this tensor in the format c11,c12,etc. This function converts these entries to c[0,0],c[0,1],etc.

  • vectors (list) ‚Äì list of strs with same logic as matrices, but instead c1,c2,etc. are converted to c[0],c[1],etc.

  • npndarray (bool) ‚Äì if True, writes the output as numpy ndarray

  • max_line_length (int) ‚Äì counts number of length until first ‚Äú]‚Äù. If larger than the specified value, line breaks occur at every ‚Äú,‚Äù, otherwise at every ‚Äú],‚Äù.

Returns:

lines ‚Äì symfem output converted to code that can be copy pasted into a function.

Return type:

str

topoptlab.symfem_utils.convert_to_voigt(A)[source]ÔÉÅ

Convert 2nd rank tensor into its Voigt representation.

Parameters:

A (symfem.functions.MatrixFunction, shape (ndim,ndim)) ‚Äì 2nd rank tensor

Returns:

A_v ‚Äì 2nd rank tensor in voigt notation

Return type:

symfem.functions.MatrixFunction, shape ((ndim**2 + ndim) /2, 1)

topoptlab.symfem_utils.determine_nodeinds(vertices, basis_funcs, ndim)[source]ÔÉÅ

Find index of each vertex by finding the basis function that amounts to 1.

For a set of vertex coordinates, determine to which basis function each vertex corresponds. Keep in mind that the current default unit cell used by symfem is in the interval [0,1] whereas mine is typically in the interval [-1,1].

Parameters:

  • vertices (tuple) ‚Äì coordinates of vertices as created by base cell

  • basis_funcs (list of symfem.functions.ScalarFunction) ‚Äì list of basis functions which are usually extracted by calling element.get_basis_functions().

  • ndim (int) ‚Äì number of dimensions

Returns:

indices ‚Äì indices of vertices

Return type:

list

topoptlab.symfem_utils.generate_constMatrix(ncol, nrow, name, symmetric=False, return_symbols=False)[source]ÔÉÅ

Generate matrix full of symbolic constants as a list of lists

Parameters:

  • ncol (int) ‚Äì number of rows.

  • nrow (int) ‚Äì number of cols.

  • name (str) ‚Äì name to put in front of indices.

  • symmetric (bool) ‚Äì if True, matrix generated in symmetric fashion

  • return_symbols (bool) ‚Äì if True, returns the list of symbols of the entries. May be needed if you want to apply assumptions on them in a Sympy assumptions context.

Returns:

  • M (symfem.functions.MatrixFunction) ‚Äì symfem MatrixFunction filled with symbolic entries e. g. for a 2x2 [[M11,M12],[M21,M22]].

  • symbol_list (list) ‚Äì list of all symbols used for the matrix/vector

topoptlab.symfem_utils.isoparametric_map(basis, vertices, ndim)[source]ÔÉÅ

Create the basic cell, location of vertices, the node indices, the reference cell and the basis functions.

Parameters:

  • basis (list) ‚Äì list of basis functions.

  • vertices (tuple) ‚Äì coordinates of vertices as created by base cell

Returns:

coord ‚Äì coordinate according to ispoarametric map

Return type:

symfem.functions.MatrixFunction, shape (ndim,1)

topoptlab.symfem_utils.jacobian(ndim, element_type='Lagrange', order=1, return_J=True, return_inv=True, return_det=True, debug=False)[source]ÔÉÅ

Symbolically compute the Jacobian of the isoparametric mapping.

Parameters:

  • ndim (int) ‚Äì number of spatial dimensions. Must be between 1 and 3.

  • element_type (str) ‚Äì type of element.

  • order (int) ‚Äì order of element.

  • return_J (bool) ‚Äì if True, return Jacobian matrix.

  • return_inv (bool) ‚Äì if True, return inverse of Jacobian matrix.

  • return_det (bool) ‚Äì if True, return determinant of Jacobian matrix.

  • debug (bool) ‚Äì if True, print additional information.

Returns:

  • J (symfem.functions.MatrixFunction) ‚Äì jacobian of isoparametric mapping.

  • Jinv (symfem.functions.MatrixFunction) ‚Äì inverse of jacobian of isoparametric mapping.

  • Jdet (symfem.functions.MatrixFunction) ‚Äì determinant of jacobian of isoparametric mapping.

topoptlab.symfem_utils.rotation_matrix(ndim, mode=None)[source]ÔÉÅ

rotation matrix around y and z axis with angles phi (y axis) and theta (z axis).

Parameters:

  • ndim (int) ‚Äì number of spatial dimensions.

  • mode (str or None) ‚Äì Either None or ‚Äúvoigt‚Äù. If None, returns the standard rotation matrix. Either None or ‚Äúvoigt‚Äù. If None, returns the standard rotation matrix. If ‚Äúvoigt‚Äù rotation matrix for 2nd rank tensors in Voigt notation (‚ÄúVoigt vectors‚Äù) or 4th rank tensors (‚ÄúVoigt matrices‚Äù).

Returns:

R ‚Äì ((ndim**2 + ndim) /2,(ndim**2 + ndim) /2) rotation matrix.

Return type:

symfem.functions.MatrixFunction, shape (ndim,ndim) or

topoptlab.symfem_utils.rotation_matrix_dangle(ndim, mode=None)[source]ÔÉÅ

1st derivative of rotation matrix around y and z axis with angles phi (y axis) and theta (z axis).

Parameters:

  • ndim (int) ‚Äì number of spatial dimensions.

  • mode (str or None) ‚Äì Either None or ‚Äúvoigt‚Äù. If None, returns derivatives of the standard rotation matrix. If ‚Äúvoigt‚Äù rotation matrix for 2nd rank tensors in Voigt notation (‚ÄúVoigt vectors‚Äù) or 4th rank tensors (‚ÄúVoigt matrices‚Äù).

Returns:

  • dRdtheta (symfem.functions.MatrixFunction, shape (ndim,ndim) or) ‚Äì ((ndim**2 + ndim) /2,(ndim**2 + ndim) /2) 1st derivative of rotation matrix with regards to theta.

  • dRdphi (symfem.functions.MatrixFunction, shape (ndim,ndim) or) ‚Äì ((ndim**2 + ndim) /2,(ndim**2 + ndim) /2) 1st derivative of rotation matrix with regards to phi.

Scale/rotate the vertices/nodes basic cell by lengths l and angles g.

Parameters:

vertices (tuple) ‚Äì coordinates of vertices as created by base cell

Returns:

vertices_new ‚Äì coordinate according to ispoarametric map

Return type:

symfem.functions.MatrixFunction, shape (ndim,1)

topoptlab.symfem_utils.shape_function_matrix(basis, nedof, mode='col')[source]ÔÉÅ

Generate the shape function matrix for scalar or vector fields.

Parameters:

  • basis (list) ‚Äì list of basis functions as generated by base_cell

  • nedof (int) ‚Äì number of nodal degrees of freedom.

  • mode (str) ‚Äì either ‚Äúrow‚Äù or ‚Äúcol‚Äù which results in shape (nedof,n_nodes) or (n_nodes,nedof)

Returns:

shape_function_matrix ‚Äì shape function matrix either of shape

Return type:

symfem.functions.MatrixFunction

Returns:

M_new ‚Äì simplified matrix.

topoptlab.symfem_utils.small_strain_matrix(ndim, nd_inds, basis, isoparam_kws)[source]ÔÉÅ

Create the small strain matrix commonly referred to as B matrix.

Parameters:

  • ndim (int) ‚Äì number of spatial dimensions.

  • element_type (str) ‚Äì type of element.

  • order (int) ‚Äì order of element.

  • basis (list) ‚Äì list of basis functions as generated by base_cell

Returns:

bmatrix ‚Äì small displacement matrix.

Return type:

symfem.functions.Matrixfunction

topoptlab.symfem_utils.stifftens_isotropic(ndim, plane_stress=True)[source]ÔÉÅ

stiffness tensor for isotropic material expressed in Terms of Young‚Äôs modulus E and Poisson‚Äôs ratio v.

Parameters:

  • ndim (int) ‚Äì number of dimensions

  • plane_stress (bool) ‚Äì if True, return stiffness tensor for plane stress, otherwise return stiffness tensor for plane strain

Returns:

c ‚Äì stiffness tensor.

Return type:

symfem.functions.MatrixFunction
